speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: SCENE VII. Gloucester's castle.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter CORNWALL, REGAN, GONERIL, EDMUND, and Servants

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Post speedily to my lord your husband; show him

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: this letter: the army of France is landed. Seek

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: out the villain Gloucester.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exeunt some of the Servants

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Hang him instantly.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Pluck out his eyes.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Leave him to my displeasure. Edmund, keep you our

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: sister company: the revenges we are bound to take

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: upon your traitorous father are not fit for your

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: beholding. Advise the duke, where you are going, to

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: a most festinate preparation: we are bound to the

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: like. Our posts shall be swift and intelligent

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: betwixt us. Farewell, dear sister: farewell, my

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: lord of Gloucester.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Enter OSWALD

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: How now! where's the king?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: My lord of Gloucester hath convey'd him hence:

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Some five or six and thirty of his knights,

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Hot questrists after him, met him at gate;

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Who, with some other of the lords dependants,

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Are gone with him towards Dover; where they boast

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: To have well-armed friends.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Get horses for your mistress.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Farewell, sweet lord, and sister.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Edmund, farewell.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exeunt GONERIL, EDMUND, and OSWALD

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Go seek the traitor Gloucester,

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Pinion him like a thief, bring him before us.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exeunt other Servants

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Though well we may not pass upon his life

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Without the form of justice, yet our power

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Shall do a courtesy to our wrath, which men

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: May blame, but not control. Who's there? the traitor?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, brought in by two or three

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Ingrateful fox! 'tis he.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Bind fast his corky arms.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What mean your graces? Good my friends, consider

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You are my guests: do me no foul play, friends.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Bind him, I say.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Servants bind him

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Hard, hard. O filthy traitor!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Unmerciful lady as you are, I'm none.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: To this chair bind him. Villain, thou shalt find--

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: REGAN plucks his beard

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: By the kind gods, 'tis most ignobly done

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To pluck me by the beard.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: So white, and such a traitor!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Naughty lady,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: These hairs, which thou dost ravish from my chin,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Will quicken, and accuse thee: I am your host:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With robbers' hands my hospitable favours

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You should not ruffle thus. What will you do?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Come, sir, what letters had you late from France?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Be simple answerer, for we know the truth.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: And what confederacy have you with the traitors

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Late footed in the kingdom?

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To whose hands have you sent the lunatic king? Speak.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I have a letter guessingly set down,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Which came from one that's of a neutral heart,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And not from one opposed.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Cunning.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And false.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Where hast thou sent the king?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To Dover.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Wherefore to Dover? Wast thou not charged at peril--

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Wherefore to Dover? Let him first answer that.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I am tied to the stake, and I must stand the course.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Wherefore to Dover, sir?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because I would not see thy cruel nails

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Pluck out his poor old eyes; nor thy fierce sister

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In his anointed flesh stick boarish fangs.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The sea, with such a storm as his bare head

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In hell-black night endured, would have buoy'd up,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And quench'd the stelled fires:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Yet, poor old heart, he holp the heavens to rain.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: If wolves had at thy gate howl'd that stern time,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou shouldst have said 'Good porter, turn the key,'

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: All cruels else subscribed: but I shall see

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The winged vengeance overtake such children.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: See't shalt thou never. Fellows, hold the chair.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Upon these eyes of thine I'll set my foot.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He that will think to live till he be old,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Give me some help! O cruel! O you gods!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: One side will mock another; the other too.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: If you see vengeance,--

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Hold your hand, my lord:

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: I have served you ever since I was a child;

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: But better service have I never done you

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Than now to bid you hold.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: How now, you dog!

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: If you did wear a beard upon your chin,

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: I'd shake it on this quarrel. What do you mean?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: My villain!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: They draw and fight

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Nay, then, come on, and take the chance of anger.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Give me thy sword. A peasant stand up thus!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Takes a sword, and runs at him behind

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: O, I am slain! My lord, you have one eye left

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: To see some mischief on him. O!

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Dies

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Lest it see more, prevent it. Out, vile jelly!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Where is thy lustre now?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: All dark and comfortless. Where's my son Edmund?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Edmund, enkindle all the sparks of nature,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To quit this horrid act.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Out, treacherous villain!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Thou call'st on him that hates thee: it was he

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: That made the overture of thy treasons to us;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Who is too good to pity thee.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O my follies! then Edgar was abused.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Kind gods, forgive me that, and prosper him!

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Go thrust him out at gates, and let him smell

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: His way to Dover.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Exit one with GLOUCESTER

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: How is't, my lord? how look you?

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I have received a hurt: follow me, lady.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Turn out that eyeless villain; throw this slave

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Upon the dunghill. Regan, I bleed apace:

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Untimely comes this hurt: give me your arm.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exit CORNWALL, led by REGAN

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: I'll never care what wickedness I do,

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: If this man come to good.

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: If she live long,

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: And in the end meet the old course of death,

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: Women will all turn monsters.

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Let's follow the old earl, and get the Bedlam

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: To lead him where he would: his roguish madness

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Allows itself to any thing.

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: Go thou: I'll fetch some flax and whites of eggs

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: To apply to his bleeding face. Now, heaven help him!

speaker: Third Servant
text_entry: Exeunt severally
